SEARCH

All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
ActionListenersManager
Manages the creation of action listeners for various UI components.
ActionListenersManager
ActionListenersManager contains all the game's ActionListeners, obtainable through static methods
AmethystRing
The AmethystRing makes the player earn 100 points for each jump.
AnimationAndImagesLoader
The AnimationAndImagesLoader class is responsible for loading and managing animations and images used in the game, including player animations, entity animations, and other game assets like bubbles and enemies.
AudioManager
 
Banebou
Represents a type of enemy called Banebou.
BlueCandy
The BLueCandy makes the PlayerBubble travel faster
Bolt
The Bolt class represents a bolt that moves horizontally across the game screen.
Boss
The Boss class represents a powerful enemy in the game with multiple lives and the ability to change directions randomly.
Bubble
The Bubble class represents an abstract bubble entity that can move and interact with enemies and the game environment.
BubbleFactory
Factory class responsible for creating different types of bubbles in the game, such as PlayerBubble, SpecialBubble, and ExtendBubble.
BubbleManager
The BubbleManager class manages the creation, updating, and removal of various types of bubbles in the game, including player bubbles, fireballs, bolts, and water bubbles.
ChangeDirection
 
CheatButton
A CheatButton is used to trigger or enable a cheat.
CheatFrame
The CheatFrame class represents a JFrame used in the game to provide various cheat options.
Clock
The Clock temporarily stops all Enemy in the level from moving
Controller
The Controller class Controller is responsible for managing the game loop and state transitions.
CrystalRing
The CrystalRing makes the player earn points for each step taken.
Dynamite
The Dynamite kills all the Enemy in the level
EditorFrame
Singleton class representing the main editor frame in the level editor.
EditorPanel
EditorPanel is responsible for displaying and interacting with the game editor grid.
End
The End class represents the end state of the game.
EndPanel
The EndPanel is shown when the game ends, displaying a different image depending on the result of it.
EndPanel.Ending
The different outcomes of the game
Enemy
The Enemy class represents an abstract enemy in the game.
Enemy.ColorState
Enum representing possible colors for the enemy.
EnemyManager
Manages the collection of enemies and lasers in the game.
Entity
The Entity class serves as the base class for all game entities.
ExtendBubble
The ExtendBubble class represents a specialized bubble that can restore the player's lives.
FireBall
The FireBall class represents a fire ball entity in the game that can fall and burn.
FireBall.FireState
Enum representing the state of the fire ball: either falling or burning.
FireBubble
The FireBubble class represents a bubble that, when popped, releases a fire ball.
Fruit
The Fruit class represents a collectible item in the game that can be picked up by the player to gain points.
Fruit.FruitType
The FruitType enum defines the types of fruits available in the game, each represented by a unique character code and a point value.
FruitManager
The FruitManager keeps track of all the Fruit contained in a Level
GameFrame
The GameFrame class represents the main window frame for the game, which displays various screens such as the menu, gameplay, win/loss panels, transitions, and pauses.
GameFrame.Screen
Enum representing the various screens that can be displayed in the game.
GameState
The GameState class is used to set the current state of the game and communicate it to the controller.
Gravity
 
HelpMethods
The HelpMethods class provides utility methods related to level physics, collisions, and entity movements.
ImageLoader
The ImageLoader class provides a static method to access th images in the resources folder.
InputManager
The InputManager redirects the key inputs to the proper State according to the current GameState
Invader
The Invader class represents an invader enemy in the game.
JBubbleBobble
 
Jumping
 
Laser
The Laser class represents a laser entity that moves vertically across the screen.
LeaderboardPanel
The LeaderboardPanel class is responsible for displaying a leaderboard of users in a graphical user interface.
LeaderboardPanel.HeaderRenderer
A custom renderer for the table header that centers the text, sets the background color to black, and applies an orange border.
Level
The Level class represents a game level, containing information about the level's layout, enemies, bubbles, power-ups, and player interactions.
LevelLoader
The LevelLoader class is responsible for loading level data from files and creating objects such as tiles and enemies based on the level's layout.
LevelManager
Manages the level data for the game, allowing levels to be created, modified, and saved to files.
LevelPanel
The LevelPanel class represents the panel where the game level is rendered.
LevelsPopUpMenu
A popup menu for managing levels in the editor.
LevelsPopUpMenu.MenuType
 
Menu
Represents Menu the menu state in the game.
MenuPanel
The MenuPanel class is responsible for rendering the main menu of the game and handling user interactions such as selecting a user, starting the editor, and viewing the leaderboard.
Model
The Model class represents the core game model and follows the Singleton pattern.
Model.ModelState
Enum representing the possible states of the game.
Monsta
The Monsta class represents a specific type of enemy in the game that bounces off walls and floors while moving.
MovingEntity
The MovingEntity class represents an entity in the game that can move, jump, and interact with the environment.
MovingEntity.Direction
Enum representing possible movement directions for the entity.
OrangeParasol
The OrangeParasol item allows the player to skip 2 level.
Parasol
The Parasol item allows the player to skip levels
Paths
The Paths class is responsible for managing and providing file paths based on specific characters.
Pause
Represents Pause the pause state in the game.
PausePanel
PausePanel is a custom JPanel that represents the pause menu in the game.
PinkCandy
The PinkCandy makes the PlayerBubble travel further
Player
The Player class represents the player character in the game.
PlayerBubble
The PlayerBubble class represents a bubble generated by the player.
Playing
Represents the state of the game when it is being played.
Powerup
The Powerup class represents a power-up entity in the game.
PowerupFactory
The PowerupFactory is responsible for generating power-ups in the game.
PowerupManager
The PowerupManager class is responsible for managing the spawning and removal of power-ups in the game.
Pulpul
The Pulpul class represents a unique enemy that can move in four directions and changes direction upon hitting obstacles.
PurpleParasol
The PurpleParasol item allows the player to skip 4 levels
RedParasol
The RedParasol item allows the player to skip 3 levels
RubyRing
The RubyRing makes the player earn 50 points for each bubble shot.
SelectionButton
A button with an image and a code.
Shoes
The Shoes are a Powerup that temporarily enhance the player's movement speed
Shooting
 
SkelMonsta
The SkelMonsta class represents an enemy that can move horizontally and vertically, changing direction upon hitting the boundaries of the game area.
SpecialBubble
The SpecialBubble class represents a bubble that, when popped, grants the player's ability to shoot for a limited time.
Sprite
Represents a sprite that can be rendered in a graphical environment.
SpriteSelectionScrollPane
A scroll pane that allows users to select various sprites, including blocks, enemies, players, and others.
State
The State class, extended by the various game state classes.
Statemethods
The Statemethods class contains the methods used by the classes extending State
ThunderBubble
The ThunderBubble class represents a bubble that spawns a lightning bolt when it collides with the player.
Tile
The Tile represents the blocks that form the level, with which the entities collide.
TransitionPanel
A JPanel TransitionPanel that handles the transition effect between game levels.
User
The class User represents a user in the game with attributes such as nickname, high score, avatar path, points, and statistics for played, won, and lost games.
UserMethods
The UserMethods class provides static methods for handling user data, such as reading user scores from files and saving user information.
UserPanel
The UserPanel class represents a panel that displays a user's avatar and nickname.
View
The View class is responsible for managing and updating the graphical components of the game.
Vulnerable
 
Water
The Water class represents a special effect entity that moves horizontally across the level, captures entities, and has a limited lifespan.
WaterBubble
The WaterBubble class represents a bubble that creates water upon popping.
YellowCandy
The YellowCandy increases the attack speed of the player
ZenChan
The ZenChan class represents an enemy that can move horizontally and jump, switching direction when hitting a wall.
